description: From Middle English schelfe, probably from Old English sċylfe (“deck of a ship”), distantly related to sculpt, carve and shell. Cognate to Dutch schelf.

entries.meaning: A flat, rigid structure, fixed at right angles to a wall or forming a part of a cabinet, desk etc., and used to support, store or display objects.
examples: We keep the old newspapers on the bottom shelf of the cupboard, and our photos on the top shelf.

entries.meaning: The capacity of such an object
A projecting ledge that resembles such an object.
(computing) The part of a repository where shelvesets are stored.
examples: This is where the Visual Studio Shelving function can help. A shelf is a place on the server in source control that is separate from the main code line so it will not affect other developers.
